item.title: Alacritty.
item.description: Go back to the dotfiles, the doc or the front page. Alacritty is a minimal terminal emulator. Some resources. the github page here. the arch wiki page here. Dependencies for alacritty. xterm-256color mode to display many colors. the mononoki nerd font: can be installed with yay -S nerd-fonts-mononoki Install alacritty manually. install the dependencies. install the alacritty command. copy alacritty.yml inside your ~/.config/alacritty directory. Gallery.
item.content:
Go back to the dotfiles, the doc or the front page.

Alacritty is a minimal terminal emulator.

Some resources.

  • the github page here.
  • the arch wiki page here.

Dependencies for alacritty.

  • xterm-256color mode to display many colors.
  • the mononoki nerd font: can be installed with yay -S nerd-fonts-mononoki

Install alacritty manually.

  • install the dependencies.
  • install the alacritty command.
  • copy alacritty.yml inside your ~/.config/alacritty directory.

Gallery.

Available soon.
Snippets on the dotfiles repo.

Go back to the dotfiles, the doc or the front page.

item.title: neofetch
item.content:
Go back to the dotfiles, the doc or the front page.

neofetch is “a command-line system information tool written in bash 3.2+”

Some resources.

  • the github page here.
  • the arch manual page here.

Dependencies for neofetch.

  • some art works in ~/.config/neofetch/ascii.

Install neofetch manually.

  • install the dependencies.
  • install the neofetch command.
  • copy config.conf, .neofetchrc and the files in ascii inside your ~/.config/neofetch directory.

Gallery.

Available soon.
Snippets on the dotfiles repo.

Go back to the dotfiles, the doc or the front page.

item.title: tmux
item.description: Go back to the dotfiles, the doc or the front page. “tmux is an open-source terminal multiplexer for Unix-like operating systems.” Some resources. the github page here. the arch wiki page here. Install tmux manually. install the tmux command. copy .tmux.conf inside your ~/ directory. Gallery. Available soon. Snippets on the dotfiles repo. Go back to the dotfiles, the doc or the front page.
item.content:
Go back to the dotfiles, the doc or the front page.

“tmux is an open-source terminal multiplexer for Unix-like operating systems.”

Some resources.

  • the github page here.
  • the arch wiki page here.

Install tmux manually.

  • install the tmux command.
  • copy .tmux.conf inside your ~/ directory.
